duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide coordination of care to meet identified needs of the patient and family.
Supervise the management of patient care using critical thinking and nursing process.
Facilitate patient care through collaborative efforts with physicians and other healthcare team members.
Coordinate patient care across the healthcare continuum and assist in meeting individual patient needs.
Conduct patient assessment, develop care plans, and evaluate outcomes.
Provide concentrated observation and care of patients during the immediate post-anesthesia period.
Assist in patient transfer on a continuum of care to the appropriate department.
Demonstrate proficiency in care delivery utilizing advanced knowledge base of various medical issues.
Communicate appropriately with the medical team on patient status variances.
Maintain knowledge of Joint Commission requirements and the National Patient Safety Goals.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in Nursing (BSN) required. Associate Degree in Nursing (ADN) considered if enrolled in a BSN program with degree completion within 2 years of hire or transfer to an RN position. Diploma or transcripts on highest degree earned required.
